H0.text: Alveoli are the little sacs at the end of the bronchioles.

H1.text: Lung are the little sacs at the end of the bronchioles.

H2.text: Respiratory sacs are the little sacs at the end of the bronchioles.

H3.text: Ganglion is the term for the little sacs at the end of the bronchioles.

A5.text: The respiratory bronchioles deliver air to the exchange surfaces of the lungs. They are interrupted by alveoli which are thin walled evaginations.

A6.text: Alveoli only become present when the conducting zone changes to the respiratory zone, from the sixteenth through the twenty-third division of the tract.
